title: "The Power of Magnetism in Healing and Well-being"
first_phrase: In the previous section, we explored the capacity of individuals to heal, and how this ability develops alongside personal magnetism. In this final part, we delve deeper into the connection between magnetism and the body. Emotions, with their physical counterparts, are experienced in the body; our thoughts tend to trap them and perpetuate their hold. This, however, is not the case with animals and children. The text also touches on the idea of symptoms entrenching themselves in the body over time, and the role of practice and discipline in developing the capacity to heal.
content: Each emotion has indeed its own physical equivalent it is related to, in the form of a specific sensation which is experienced in the body. If, for instance, we are “tense”, what we are experiencing consists in a physical sensation, just as being “enraged” is an event which is lived (for most of the people) at the level of the stomach. The problem, normally, is not represented by the existence of the emotion per se, but in the fact that such emotion remains “trapped” in the body. In the ordinary course, our thought processes are what give rise to such trapping block, and they have a propensity to perpetuate it. When it comes to animals and children, emotion does not last long. Conversely, in adults it has a tendency to be trapped inwardly and turn into a chronic state. In fact, every symptom which is kept alive for a sufficiently long time is prone to “entrenching itself” in the body.
last_phrase: In conclusion, acknowledging and understanding the physical sensations associated with our emotions is crucial in preventing them from becoming trapped and potentially leading to chronic conditions. Magnetism can be a helpful tool in restoring well-being by releasing this trapped energy, without necessarily addressing the underlying cause verbally. Prioritizing our physical and emotional health is essential to live a fulfilling and healthy life.
